items.abstract: <jats:p>The densities of liquid mixtures in the systems AgCl-Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>S, AgCl-Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se, AgCl-Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te, AgBr—Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te, AgJ–Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te and AgJ–Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>S have been determined as a function of composition and temperature by a dilatometric method. The molvoluminaisotherms of the systems AgJ—Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>S and AgJ–Ag<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te show negative deviations from ideality, the other systems behave ideally.</jats:p>
title: Silberhalogenid-Silberchalkogenidsysteme, II Dichten geschmolzener Silberhalogenid-Silberchalkogenidmischungen / Silver Halide-Silver Chalcogenide Systems, II Densities of Liquid Silver Halide-Silver Chalcogenide Mixtures

items.abstract: <jats:p>The colourless compound Na<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>O(CN) has been prepared. The characterization by X-ray powder methods leads to a cubic primitive lattice (P m 3 m) with a = 456(2) pm (Z = 1). The structure is related to the anti-perovskite type.</jats:p>
title: Notizen: Na3O(CN) — das erste Alkalimetallchalkogenidpseudohalogenid / Na3O(CN) — the First Alkali Metal Chalcogenide Pseudohalide

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
				<jats:p><jats:sup>95</jats:sup>Mo Fourier transform nuclear magnetic resonance studies were made on aqueous solutions of oxo thiomolybdates. Chemical shifts up to 2200 ppm were found for the different unambiguously assigned species MoO<jats:sub>4-n</jats:sub>S<jats:sub>n</jats:sub><jats:sup>2- </jats:sup>(n = 0, 1, 2, 3, 4).</jats:p>
title: NOTIZEN: Use of 95Mo NMR for Identification of Molybdenum (VI) Chalcogenide Anions in Aqueous Solution
subject: Physical and Theoretical Chemistry
Mathematical Physics
General Physics and Astronomy

items.abstract: <jats:p>The colourless compounds Li<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>OBr and Li<jats:sub>7</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Br<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> have been prepared and characterized by X-ray diffraction techniques. Li<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>OBr crystallizes in a cubic primitive lattice (Pm3m) with a = 405.6(1) pm (Z = 1). The structure is related to the anti-perovskite type. Li<jats:sub>7</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Br<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> crystallizes in a tetragonal bodycentered lattice (I4/mmm) with a = 403.5(1) pm, c = 2161(1) pm (Z = 2) and is isotypic to Sr<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Ti<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O7.</jats:p>
title: Li7O2Br3 — Eine weitere Strukturvariante der neuen Alkalimetallchalkogenidhalogenid-Perowskite / Li7O2Br3 — A Further Structure Variant of the New Alkali Metal Chalcogenide Halide Perovskites

items.abstract: <jats:p>Al<jats:sub>7</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>10</jats:sub> is prepared from a melt of the elements in stoichiometric amounts in a corundum crucible contained in a sealed quartz ampoule. The ruby red cube shaped crystals are stable below 840 K. The structure of Al<jats:sub>7</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>10</jats:sub> (R32-D<jats:sub>3</jats:sub><jats:sup>7</jats:sup> a = 1439.5 pm, c = 1793.2 pm, Z = 6, R = 0.03) is a distorted defect variant of a tetrahedral arrangement of the 4H-polytype. The central unit, a double barrelane [Te<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>Al<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>-Al<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>], contains an Al -Al bond of 260 pm, which is somewhat longer (n = 0.83) than an expected single bond (250 pm, n = 1). This homopolar bond disturbs the electrostatically favorable (Al-Te-)<jats:sub>n</jats:sub> sequence in the structure which is compensated by the occurrence of four-membered Al<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>2</jats:sub> rings. Al<jats:sub>7</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>10</jats:sub> is a Zintl phase according to 1/2{[Al<jats:sup>2+</jats:sup>-Al<jats:sup>2+</jats:sup>][Al<jats:sup>3+</jats:sup>]<jats:sub>12</jats:sub>[Te<jats:sup>2-</jats:sup>]<jats:sub>20</jats:sub>} and exhibits semiconducting and diamagnetic behaviour.</jats:p>
title: Al7Te10 — das erste Chalcogenid mit zweiwertigem Aluminium / Al7Te10 — the First Chalcogenide of Divalent Aluminum
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>The phase diagrams of the systems SnX<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-SnY (X = Cl, Br, J, Y = S, Se, Te) were determined. New compounds were found in the systems SnBr<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-SnS and SnJ<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-SnSe.</jats:p>
title: Zinn(II)halogenid-Zinn(II)chalkogenidsysteme / Tin(II)halide-Tin(II)chalcogenide Systems
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>Four types of heterojunctions were prepared: SnO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-As<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>(Se<jats:sub>0.9</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>0.1</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>, SnO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-(As<jats:sub>0.67</jats:sub>Sb<jats:sub>0.33</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>, n-GaAs-As<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> and n-GaAs-As<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>S<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>. For all samples I-V characteristics and photosensitivity spectra were obtained. These heterostructures can be used for manufacturing rectifying devices and photoreceivers.</jats:p>
title: Preparation and Study of Heterojunctions Based on Chalcogenide Glassy Semiconductors
subject: Physical and Theoretical Chemistry
Mathematical Physics
General Physics and Astronomy

title: Viscoelastic properties of chalcogenide glasses and the simulation of their molding processes

items.abstract: <jats:p>The colourless compounds Na<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>OCl and Na<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>OBr have been prepared and characterized by X-ray diffraction techniques. Na<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>OCl crystallizes in a cubic primitive lattice with a = 450.0(3) pm (Z = 1). Na<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>OBr is isotypic with Na<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>OCl and its lattice constant is a = 457.3(5) pm. The structures are related to the anti-perowskitetype</jats:p>
title: Na3OCl und Na3OBr, die ersten Alkalimetallchalkogenidhalogenide / Na3OCl and Na3OBr, the First Alkali Metal Chalcogenide Halides

items.abstract: <jats:p>The maximum grade of substitution to be reached in solid solutions Ag<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Cl<jats:sub>1−x</jats:sub>Br<jats:sub>x</jats:sub> by solid state melting reactions starting from the elements, is x = 0.65. Using solvothermal synthesis in aqueous ammonia solution, the area of stability can be extended to pure bromide (x = 1). X-Ray diffraction experiments have substantiated the isostructural features of Ag<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Br compared with the chlorine analog. At r. t. Ag<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Br crystallizes monoclinically, in the β -Ag<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Cl structure type, with lattice parameters of a = 14.000(5), b = 7.702(3), c = 13.856(6) Å , β = 90.61(4)°, space group P2<jats:sub>1</jats:sub>/n. A topological approach, first introduced for the characterization of complex structures of silver(I) (poly)chalcogenide halides, has been transferred to the Ag<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>Q<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>X system. Based on this formalism the anion substructures can be described by simple nets or strands created by the connection of positions at distances close to or even larger than the sum of the van der Waals radii. In case of the present system, only honeycomb-like telluride nets and halide strands are necessary to explain the complex anion substructure. A deeper understanding of the physical properties, like the anisotropic silver mobility, can be achieved by this topological approach which was not possible with other structure description models.</jats:p>
title: Structure Chemical Aspects of Silver(I) Chalcogenide Halides and Preparation of the x = 1 Member of the Solid Solution Ag5Te2Cl1–xBrx
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>X-Ray diffraction experiments, thermal analyses and EDX spectroscopy were performed to determine the structural and thermal properties of the solid solutions Ag<jats:sub>10</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>4−q</jats:sub>S<jats:sub>q</jats:sub>Br<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> and Ag<jats:sub>10</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>4−p</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>p</jats:sub>Br<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>. The present investigation completes the work on silver(I) (poly)chalcogenide halides, a new class of mixed electron and ion conductors, with the general composition Ag<jats:sub>10</jats:sub>Q<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>X<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> (Q = chalcogen and X = halogen). A high silver mobility within the polytelluride substructure and a pronounced polymorphism are characteristic features of these solid electrolytes. Phase transition temperatures are reduced upon the substitution of Te by the lighter homologs Se and S. Even low degrees of substitution lead to significantly lower phase transitions for the high-temperature polymorphs compared with Ag<jats:sub>10</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>Br<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>. A permanent disorder within the silver substructure is present for the maximally substituted sulfur containing phases.</jats:p>
title: Structures and Thermal Properties of Silver(I) (Poly)chalcogenide Halide Solid Solutions Ag10Te4–(q, p)Q(q, p)Br3 with Q = S, Se
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>The colourless compound Na<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>OI<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>: has been prepared and characterized by X-ray diffraction techniques. Na<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>OI<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>: crystallizes in a tetragonal body-centered lattice with a = 467.7(1) pm, c = 1602.0(3) pm (Z = 2) and is isotypic to K<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>NiF<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>.</jats:p>
title: Na4OI2 — ein neuer Alkalimetallchalkogenidhalogenid-Typ/Na4OI2 — a New Type of Alkali Metal Chalcogenide Halide

items.abstract: <jats:p>The synthesis via the useful lithium reagent intermediate, (C<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>P(S)CH<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Li, is reported for eight compounds of the type [(C<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>P(X)][R<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>P(X)]<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>CH, where R is methyl or phenyl and X is an electron pair, oxygen, or sulfur in various combinations. Two related compounds with three and four phosphorus atoms, respectively, per molecule have also been prepared from the same lithium reagent. Tris(diphenylthiophosphoryl)methane has three equivalent phosphorus atoms as indicated by the room temperature phosphorus-31 NMR spectrum, but at reduced temperature a favored conformation exists which has two equivalent phosphorus atoms and a unique one. Other phosphorus-31 and proton NMR data are reported</jats:p>
title: Polydentate Ligands Containing Phosphorus, III [1]. Synthesis and Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Studies of Some Unsymmetrical Potentially Tridentate Phosphine Chalcogenide Ligands

items.abstract: <jats:p>Quaternary chalcogenide halides M<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>M′X<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Y (M = Zn, Cd; M′ = Al, Ga, In; X = Se, Te; Y = Cl, Br, I) can be synthesized by heating stoichiometric amounts of the binary components MX. MY<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>, and M′<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>X<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> in evacuated sealed quartz ampoules. In the case of aluminium and gallium compounds, a mixture of the M′ and X elements rather than the binary compounds has been used. The products are typical tetrahedral compounds, crystallizing with either the defect wurtzite-type or the defect zinc-blende-type structure. At 25 kbar, and 1400 °C, Cd<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>InSe<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Cl, Cd<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>InSe<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Br, and Cd<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>InSe<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>I transform from the defect wurtzite-type structure to quenchable high-pressure phases with defect NaCl-type structure. The retransformation to the ambient-pressure phases proceeds via intermediates having the defect zinc-blende-type structure. Some aspects of the apparent non-stoichiometry in the high-pressure phases are discussed</jats:p>
title: Synthese und Hochdruckverhalten quaternärer Chalkogenidhalogenide M2M′X3Y (M = Zn, Cd; M′ = Al, Ga, In; X = Se, Te; Y = CI, Br, I) / Synthesis and High-Pressure Behaviour of Quaternary Chalcogenide Halides M2M′X3Y (M = Zn, Cd; M′ = Al, Ga, In; X = Se, Te; Y = Cl, Br, I)
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
				<jats:p> Quaternary compounds AB<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>X<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Y (A = Cu, Ag; B = In; X = S, Se, Te; Y = Cl, Br, I) could be synthesized at high pressures and temperatures. The crystal structures found are defect-zincblende (AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>I, AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>l, CuIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Br, CuIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>I, CuIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Cl, CuIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Br, CuInTe<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>I), spinel (AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>S<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Cl, AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>S<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Br, AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Cl, AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Br, AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>l) and defect-rocksalt (AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Cl, AgIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Te<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>Br). A second form of CuIn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>Se<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>l is intermediate between the zincblende and spinel structure. A survey of the different reaction pathways of AB-B<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>X<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> mixtures at high pressures and temperatures is given.</jats:p>
title: Hochdrucksynthese quaternärer Chalkogenidhalogenide AB2X3Y (A = Cu, Ag; B = In; X = S, Se, Te; Y = Cl, Br, I)/High Pressure Synthesis of Quaternary Chalcogenide Halogenides AB2X3Y (A = Cu, Ag; B = In; X = S, Se, Te; Y = Cl, Br, I)
subject: General Chemistry
